name: Broken Blender
desc: An old, weathered blender made of plastics and trace metals. Electronic guts spew through its broken base.

name: Rusted Washing Machine
desc: A thrown out washing machine. There’s plenty of crude metal to salvage, if you can carry it.

name: Busted Flashlight
desc: A heavy-duty flashlight, the bulb hanging on by a scrap. Not particularly worth much.

name: Laptop
desc: A long forgotten laptop, subjected to the elements. As valuable as they are rare.

name: Copper Wiring
desc: Discarded, copper wiring. They appear to have been cut and shredded before being discarded.

name: Metal Pipe
desc: A thick, metal pipe. Quite heavy, but a good piece of scrap.

name: Broken Fan
desc: A discarded fan, surprisingly intact. Some of its internals could prove valuable.

name: TV
desc: The broken shell of a tv. Heavy and cumbersome, but could hold valuable scrap.

name: Sink
desc: A thrown out sink. It’s made of cracked ceramic.

name: Toilet
desc: A broken toilet. Is heavy, but contains plenty of ceramic.

name: Car Engine
desc: A discarded car engine. Is staggeringly heavy, but holds the motherload of metal.

name: Cell Phone
desc: A broken cell phone. Trace amounts of rare metals are within.

name: Car Battery
desc: The discarded battery of a car. Could prove valuable.

name: Spark Plug
desc: An old spark plug. Broken, but could be fixed.

name: Coil Spring
desc: A portion of a car’s suspension. Still in good shape.

name: Radiator
desc: A thrown out car radiator. A bit heavy, but still valuable.

name: Car Mirror
desc: A cracked car mirror. Could still work.

name: Car wheel
desc: A wheel frame for a car. It could be repurposed.

name: Alternator
desc: A discarded alternator from a car. It still works, somehow.

name: Blue Toothbrush
desc: It appears to have been used by multiple rats.

name: Klein Bottle
desc: I’m not quite sure how to orient this thing.

name: last item
desc: there are no more items!!!
